snippet: A proposed law would require international organizations to find a government sponsor, seek police approval for all “activities” and hire Chinese citizens for at least half of all staff positions.
abstract: China announces new law expected to pass later this year which tightens regulation of foreign nonprofits and nongovernment groups, in effort to root out organizations that harm country's interests; international groups, which have mostly contributed to nation's boon, say legislation could force them to cut back on their operations there, because law would put their activities under the auspices of China's security apparatus.
lead_paragraph: A proposed law would require international organizations to find a government sponsor, seek police approval for all “activities” and hire Chinese citizens for at least half of all staff positions.

headline.main: Foreign Groups Fear China Oversight Plan
headline.print_headline: Foreign Groups Fear China Oversight Plan
